Headshot.name: Headshot
Headshot.blurb: Every few basic attacks, or against a target she has trapped or netted, Caitlyn will fire a headshot dealing bonus damage that scales with her critical strike chance. On trapped or netted targets, Caitlyn's Headshot attack range is doubled.
Headshot.description: Innate: Caitlyn's basic attacks generate a stack of Headshot on-attack, doubled when attacking from  brush. At 6 stacks, or 5 while in brush, Caitlyn's next basic attack deals (50 / 75 / 100% (based on level) + (125% +  15.625%) critical strike chance) AD  bonus physical damage, increased to (100% + (125% +  15.625%) critical strike chance) AD against non-champions.
Headshot.description2: Caitlyn may fire other empowered basic attacks until Headshot hits a target, which consumes all stacks.
Headshot.description3: Enemies  rooted by  Yordle Snap Trap or  slowed by  90 Caliber Net can grant an additional headshot at  1300 range for 1.8 seconds.
Headshot.notes:
* The bonus range from  Rapid Firecannon will not have any effect during  trap and  net extended Headshot attacks.
 As with most on-hit physical damage, the bonus damage from Headshot will apply  life steal.
 Attacking wards will still generate stacks towards Headshot but empowered attack will not be consumed.
 The basic attack triggering Headshot can  critically strike, but Headshot's damage remains unchanged if it does.
 Ability-granted Headshots are abilities that apply on-hit effects. They will not interact with effects that apply on-attack (including stacking Headshot).
  Energized, which normally stacks on-attack, has been special cased to stack on-hit for these empowered attacks.

Piltover Peacemaker.name: Piltover Peacemaker
Piltover Peacemaker.blurb: Caitlyn revs up her rifle for 1 second to unleash a penetrating shot that deals physical damage (deals less damage to subsequent targets).
Piltover Peacemaker.description: Active: Caitlyn fires a projectile in the target direction that deals physical damage to the first enemy it passes through, after which it expands in width but deals only 60% damage to all enemies it passes thereafter.
Piltover Peacemaker.description2: Enemies  revealed by  Yordle Snap Trap always take full damage from Piltover Peacemaker.
Piltover Peacemaker.notes: * Enemies hit while protected by a  spell shield will still be considered a target for calculating damage for subsequent hits.

Yordle Snap Trap.name: Yordle Snap Trap
Yordle Snap Trap.blurb: Caitlyn sets a trap to find sneaky yordles. When sprung, the trap reveals and immobilizes the enemy champion for 1.5 seconds.
Yordle Snap Trap.description: Passive: Caitlyn periodically stocks a Yordle Snap Trap charge, up to a maximum amount.
Yordle Snap Trap.description2: Active: Caitlyn sets a visible  untargetable trap at the target location which briefly grants  sight of the area and arms after 1 second, lasting for a duration. After the maximum amount of traps is laid down, deploying another immediately destroys the oldest one.
Yordle Snap Trap.description3: The next enemy champion that springs the trap is  rooted for 1.5 seconds,  revealed for 3 seconds, takes additional damage from  Headshot, and becomes immune to Yordle Snap Traps for 2 seconds, increased by 1 second for each Yordle Snap Trap they're consecutively affected.

90 Caliber Net.name: 90 Caliber Net
90 Caliber Net.blurb: Caitlyn fires a heavy net to slow her target. The recoil knocks Caitlyn back.
90 Caliber Net.description: Active: Caitlyn fires a net and  recoils 400 units in the opposite direction, dealing  magic damage to the first enemy hit and  slowing them by 50% for 1 second.
90 Caliber Net.notes:
* The knockback can be used to pass through terrain.
 Unlike similar abilities ( Rocket Jump,  Arcane Shift, etc.) 90 Caliber Net has a short channel (rather than a cast time) making it interruptable.

Ace in the Hole.name: Ace in the Hole
Ace in the Hole.blurb: Caitlyn takes time to line up the perfect shot, dealing massive damage to a single target at a huge range. Enemy champions can intercept the bullet for their ally.
Ace in the Hole.description: Active: After a brief delay, Caitlyn locks onto a target enemy champion and channels for 1 second, gaining  true sight of the target and  revealing herself to the enemies.
Ace in the Hole.description2: Once Caitlyn completes the channel, she fires a homing projectile toward the target that deals physical damage to the first enemy champion it hits.
Ace in the Hole.description3: If the target dies during the channel the ability is cancelled and put on a 5-second cooldown.
Ace in the Hole.notes:
* The ability will still consume mana if it's cancelled and put on reduced cooldown.
 If Caitlyn loses  sight of her target before she locks on, the ability cancels but does not go on cooldown or consume any mana.
 If the target dies after the bullet has been fired, the shot will continue towards their corpse and may still hit other enemy champions.
